text: Zwart zeer levendig bier met veel schuim. Smaak is licht bitter en ietwat zoet met iets van anijs en drop met diepe fruitige en kruidige tonen van nootmuskaat, pruimen en druif.
Bottle a black colored beer with a white-off head aroma malts citrus fruits spicy and bitter hops flavor malts citrus fruits some roasted malts and a bitter hoppy aftertaste

Dark beer with some ruby highlights when held against the light. Really fizzy beige head that shrank to not much. Very lively on the tongue, to the point of being distracting. Pine and brown sugar nose. Brown sugar, buttered toast, pine, lime peel, aand a stale tea finish. odd beer.
Black with brown lacing foam head. Did not expect this color. Nice hoppy aroma and bitter taste, light caramel, some roast tones. (Rotterdam 201701)
Tap at Arendnest, 21st December 16. Pours a dark brown, black. Aroma is bitter, pine. Taste is bitter, slight cream, unusual, nice though

Bottle at hop bierfestival Rotterdam. Black pour, thick beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, fruity hops, tea, floral and spicy. Flavor is quite bitter, roasted and somewhat fruity. Nice balance and a thick body.

33cl bottle at home. Dark brown with a medium beige head. Medium body with low to moderate carbonation. Subtle sweetness with some herbal bitterness. Tea, laurel, caramel, raisin, spices, malts and herbs. Quite good.

Une earl grey black steam beer, genre californien bien sûr, de 4,8 % abv pour 44 ebu, avec malt pils
et divers colorés, houblonnée au Pride of ringwood dAustralie.
Mon exemplaire avait 3 mois de plus que sa date limite.
Couleur brun noir intense, à lopacité très forte (ebc de 88).
Mousse brun moyen foncé, à flocons fins, stable à 3 mm.
Arômes de malt fin, jus de poire cuit, écorce de chêne, groseille à maquereau.
1ère bouche souple sur du café, bois rôti, pointe de fumée très fine.
Arrière-bouche large, bien équilibrée, au mat torréfié très long.
2ème nez de groseilles noires fines.
Bouche à la magnifique évolution maltée.
Arrière-bouche avec un équilibre malt/houblon vraiment performant.
3ème à la grande suite maltée avec une pointe de thé.
Arrière-bouche suave.
Longueur qui se déguste avec des nuances superbes.
Jambes fines, longues.
Levure de caractère, boisée, très belle ligne.
Alcool qui fait beaucoup plus que son niveau, il tient lensemble avec brio.
Finale qui donne encore dautres nuances.
CONCLUSION : grande bière californienne, qui dabord ne présente aucun défaut, mais bien plus, qui ouvre la perspective dune steam beer sur un horizon encore non atteint. Le fait dêtre en black
steam ny est pas étranger  Très beau.

Van de tap @Kaapse Brouwers. Mooi donkerbruin bier. Aromas van mout en hop. Smaken van geroosterde mout, hop, chocola, caramel, drop. De nasmaak is bitter en redelijk lang. Een prettig, fris, hoppig bitter bier.

Tap at Lentebierfestival. Dark brown, near black, light tan head. Chocolate malts, roastedness, milk chocolate, some exotic spice. Light sweet, medium bitter. Under medium body. Light carbonation. Quite tea-leaf dry, yet sweet finish. Chocolate milky something.

Tap at Grote Markt festival. Very dark brown with short lasting beige head. Lots of weird citrus notes with Asian limes, regular limes, Thai spices, lemongrass, stale coffee, caramel, nuts. Quite complex! Light sweet and under medium bitter. Above light bodied with slick feel.

Many thanks to Beerhunter111 for sharing. The beer starts nice earthy and deep. The hops are nice earthy floral, round on a malty dark body. Fresh and smooth, round but a bit dry-powdery. Nice intense floral in the aftertaste. The hops are round, earthy and bitter. Nice stuff!

33cl bottle. Pours hazy very dark brown colour with a huge big good lasting tan head. Aroma of sweet chocolate, some coffee, dark fruits, molasses. Taste of dark roasted malt, coffee, molasses, liquorice, dark fruits, good stuff!
Earthy aroma of tea with some licorice. Taste is chocolate and caramel. A bit of berries.

Bottle at home. Aroma of malt, liquorice, tea, berries, earthy notes, coffee, hint of roast, hops in the finish. Flavour is light sweet with an over moderate bitter finish. Body is medium. Curious beer, but I definitely liked it.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours black with tan head. 
Aroma thea, roasted malts, caramel, chocolate. 
Taste caramel chocolate sweets, roasted coffee citrus bitter. 
Mouthfeel thin. 
Great Beer!

Van de tap Gedronken op kimchi festival bij de ceuvel. Zwart met een bescheiden creme kraag. Geur en smaak zijn moutig, met koffie en licht gehopt. Body is iets wat dun. Earl grey haal ik er niet helemaal uit.

bottle sample, poured a dark amber brown colour with a caramel coloured head. aroma has sweet caramel malts, sweet caramel, roast, earth, slight smoke notes? raisin, and herbal notes, weak bodied mouthfeel. with a weird aftertaste. not good

Black with thin head. The Earl Grey is very noticable in the aroma. Less so in the flavour but theres still a background sweet, floral taste. Very bitter with lots of burntness and floral hop in the aftertaste.

On tap at Proeflokaal Arendsnest in Amsterdam. I left the most interesting one from my trip to Amsterdam to the end. A promised California Common, black, with Earl Grey? Sign my on!
Pours opaque black, nice chocolate head with decent retention. A very fresh aroma of bergamot, orange flowers, roasted malts, caramel and some earthy notes. Taste of burned toast and caramel malt, oranges, vanilla chocolate. Very nice and interesting, but not sure about the style.

Bottle shared by benzai.... medium to large foamy off-white head.... opage black colour some brown glow...smell malts roasted somewhat smokey... taste malt some hops bit roasted hint of smoke not much of the fruits its talks about. But not to bad...

Bottle @ home shared with Thompson. Opaque dark brown color, medium sized beige to light brown colored head that lasts for quite a while. Aroma is malts, some roast, liquorice, lightly tea. Taste malts, lightly roast, again lightly tea and tea bitter. Medium body, suitable carbonation. Not bad at all, quite pleasant.

Bottle from Burg Bieren, batch 20150121 BB 03-16, large sample. Dark brown color, medium frothy dark brown head. Aroma has some roast, slight smokey tea, plant-like earthy hop, wet wood. Slight wood and smoke in taste, again earthy, soft to medium bitter. Lots of stuff going on, but its all quite weird. Full of flavor and quite powerful, but not really my taste.

On tap at Arendsnest. Almost black colour, beige head. Aroma of liquorice, earth, light fruity, roasted malts, light hoppy. Flavour is medium sweet, roasted malts, light ashy, caramel, liquorice, earth, hops, light fruity, bitter finish. Light bodied, a bit watery. Nice, but California Common? They must have redefined the style then. Bottom fermented (Baltic) porter. But that moniker doesnt do it justice either. Im confused.

Draft @ Uiltje bar. Pours s dark brown beer, medium cloudy with a big beige head on top. Aroma is malty, caramel, yeasty. Flavor is sweet and malty, a bit boring with a bitter, light aftertaste with touches of licorice. Decent enough.
Tap at DCBF15, infused with sherry soaked wood and coffee beans. Didnt take proper tasting notes. Coffee dominates.

Poured deep dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of tea, berries and caramel malt. Light to medium body, flavour of the bitter tea dominates, moderately bitter and lightly sweet. OK, but not really my taste.

33cl bottle from ABCbeers.
Clear almost black pour. Thin creamy tan head. Some coffee in the aftertaste. Lingering bitterness.

Bottle 33cl. Deep dark brown with a nice white head. Nose is Malt, some sweet, soapy and licorish. Medium body with an average carbonation. Taste is light sweet, roasty salty flavor, with a very strong earthy bitterness and soapy tones. Aftertaste is strong earthy bitter which last long. Unpleasent bitter beer with a strange soapy taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Deep dark brown color. Malt, caramel and licorice in the aroma. Malty sweet, roasty salty flavor with licorice. Lots of floral grassy hops. Blackberries. Tasty brew.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2015 draft @ zonder zeil.
its got a roasty aroma, but there is still some fruity freshness to be found.
taste the same. a light roasted body with a light fruity (tropical?) taste as well. you can slightly taste the earl grey tea (although not mentioned as an ingredient on the label, weird!), which gives it an extra (balanced) dimension. very drinkable, and very light in alcohol.

Draft at Murphys Law. Pours near black with a bubbly tan head. Aroma of roast, weedy and grassy hops, light coffee. Flavor is light moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.
